paper_abstract: Traffic engineering plays a critical role in determining the performance and reliability of a network. A major challenge in traffic engineering is how to cope with dynamic and unpredictable changes in traffic demand. In this paper, we propose COPE, a class of traffic engineering algorithms that optimize for the expected scenarios while providing a worst-case guarantee for unexpected scenarios. Using extensive evaluations based on real topologies and traffic traces, we show that COPE can achieve efficient resource utilization and avoid network congestion in a wide variety of scenarios.
paper_title: COPE: Traffic engineering in dynamic networks
